info.description: Synology Drive APIs empower developers to seamlessly integrate file management, sharing, and collaboration features into compatible systems. Leverage Synology Drive resources to create, manage, and search files within Synology's secure, trusted ecosystem. Whether you're building custom applications or optimizing existing workflows, the REST APIs enable you to create solutions that ensure data security, operational efficiency, and flexible scalability within the private cloud.{X-SYSTEM-REQUIREMENTS}
info.title: Synology Drive

sid.description: Session ID required for subsequent API calls.

data.sid: your session id required for subsequent API calls

post.description: Sign in DSM to obtain `sid` which is required for subsequent API calls.

format.description: Session id return format. Set it to literal `sid` to ensure compatibility.

post.description: Sign out the DSM session corresponding to the specified `_sid`.

Convert files to Synology Office. This API is asynchronous, returning an async task ID immediately while the conversion runs in the background. Synology Office must be installed for this API to function properly.

conflict_action.description: The fallback action when file name is conflicted in destination folder. Valid values are overwrite, autorename, stop, version.

files.description: The collection of file paths selected by the user, including both directories and files.

post.description: Copy a file or a folder include sub tree to another parent folder. This API is asynchronous, which returns a async task ID immediately and runs task in the background.

files.description: Array of file paths to be copied.

dry_run.description: Dry run copy action without actually perform on the file system. If this parameter is set to true, it will report files can be copied safely or return conflicted files in destination folder. (default: false)

conflict_action.description: The fallback action when file name is conflicted in destination folder. Valid values are overwrite, autorename, stop, version. (default: autorename)

to_parent_folder.description: The path of destination parent folder.

content_snippet.description: The highlight of content snippet in search result.

hash.description: Hash for the content of the file.

labels.description: Array of LabelInfo attached on this file.

permanent_link.description: Permanent link UUID for this file.

shared_with.description: Array of PermissionInfo about shared users. Note that if user has no capability to manage sharing, this attribute will be empty array even shared is true.

sync_to_device.description: Whether the file is selected to be sync across devices. This attribute is only valid in the response from Files.list_shared_with_me API.

shared.description: Whether the file is shared with others.

starred.description: Whether the user has starred the file.

removed.description: Indicate this file is removed or not.

max_id.description: Max sync id under a folder

version_id.description: The current version of the file.

change_time.description: The last time the file state was changed by anyone.

modified_time.description: The last time the file was modified by anyone.

access_time.description: The last time the file was accessed by anyone.

parent_id.description: The ID of parent folder of the file.

content_type.description: File content types. Valid values are dir, document, image, audio, video, file.

type.description: File types. Valid values are file, dir.

display_path.description: The usable path where current user can accessed. If user has privilege in original file path (somewhere in my drive or team folders), original path will be returned, otherwise, a path from shared with me will be returned.

path.description: The file path in current category navigation.

post.description: This API allows app to create file directly with base64 encoded contents which only support contents up to 1MB in size. For larger files, use upload API.

file_content.description: Base64 encoded file content. This field supports length up to 1MB in size.

labels.description: Array of label_id to be tagged. Note this parameter is mainly for migration. (default: none)

modified_time.description: The last time the file was modified. (default: created_time)

access_time.description: The last time the file was accessed. (default: created_time)

created_time.description: The time of file creation. (default: server current time)

parameters.name: mute

schema.description: If true, this file operation won't record in recently access list and won't send any notification to user. (default: false)

schema.description: Whether the file is removed into recycle bin. This parameter is mainly used to create revision in the recycle bin, normal app should not use it. (default: false)

post.description: Download a file or a folder as a compressed archive.

dry_run.description: Test if this download request can be done. It's useful to when download encrypted files which need passwords. (default: false)

force_download.description: Force to trigger browser download by setting content-type to application/octet-stream and adding content-disposition header. (default: false)

archive_name.description: The file name of archive. (default: download)

files.description: Array of file paths to be downloaded. If multiple files are selected, they will be archived in zip file with "archive_name" as file name.

total.description: The total number of items ignoring limit.

items.description: An array containing the listed nodes.

search_time.description: The time spent in elastic search daemon.

total.description: The total number of items ignoring limit.

items.description: An array containing the listed nodes.

post.description: Search files by name, date, label, or location. The backend search engine is integrated with Synology Universal Search.

content_snippet.description: Extract content snippet of the file in search result. (default: false)

max_size.description: The maximum size of the file.

min_size.description: The minimum size of the file.

end_date.description: The Unix timestamp of last modified time range.

start_date.description: The Unix timestamp of last modified time range.

time.description: Time field used to search in range between start_date and end_date. Valid values are created_time, modified_time.

labels.description: Array of label_id to be searched.

owner.description: The owner of file. Valid values are any, me, not_me, custom. (default: any)

location.description: Location to be searched. Valid values are any, mydrive, team_folders shared_with_me, shared_with_others, starred, custom and valid path format (default: any)

file_type.description: The type of the file. Valid values are any, file, folder, document, audio, image, video, odoc, osheet, oslides, and custom. (default: any)

schema.description: The ascending direction of the sorted list. Valid values are desc, asc. (default: asc)

post.summary: Enable, disable, or configure settings for team folders and my drive
post.description:
Enable, disable, or configure settings for Team Folders and My Drive in Synology Drive.
Note: Before making any changes, use the ***Admin Console > List share folders and settings*** API to retrieve the current settings of the target Team Folder. When sending a request, ensure that all retrieved attributes (such as `Disable Download` and `Watermark`) are included; otherwise, these settings will be reset.
Additionally, when updating the settings of an enabled Team Folder, do not include the `enable_share` attribute , as the request will be ignored.

get.description: List share folders on the device that can be enabled as Team folders of Synology Drive or the settings of enabled Team folders.

code.description:
Table:
| Code | Description | 
 | - | - | 
 | 401 | Generic errors. | 
 | 402 | The request is only allowed to administrator. | 
 | 403 | The request is not allowed to the login user. | 
 | 404 | Fail to get download link for client. | 
 | 405 | The previous download task is not yet finished. | 
 | 406 | The previous restore task is not yet finished. | 
 | 407 | The previous delete task is not yet finished. | 
 | 408 | Restore task failed due to file conflict. | 
 | 409 | Restore task failed due to full volume. | 
 | 500 | Package is disabled. | 
 | 501 | Package is not ready for the user or share. | 
 | 502 | Some volumes is full. | 
 | 503 | Package is paused due to migrate database. | 
 | 600 | Try to moving database to a full volume. | 
 | 601 | No such volume. | 
 | 602 | The volume shuould to be writable. | 
 | 603 | The requested share is not yet mounted. | 
 | 604 | Try to moving database to a invalid volume. |

error.description: Indicate the error if the request failed.

type.description: The type of notification destination. Valid values are shared_library and url.

x-servers-description: Specify the connection to your Synology NAS.
x-security-description:
Please [Sign in](#post-/api/SynologyDrive/default/v1/login) first to retrieve your sid.
Then, enter your `sid` in the field below using the following format: `id={sid};` to apply your session ID in the cookie header. Once you set the `sid`, it will automatically apply to all APIs.

/Support/resources.description:
Postman Testing Guide

API testing helps teams verify whether Synology Office Suite API endpoints, methods, and integrations function as expected.


Step1. Obtain the API Specification

Before testing an API, you need its specification, which outlines the available endpoints, parameters, and methods. Download the API specification for Synology Office Suite packages to explore their API capabilities.

  • Synology Drive
  • Synology Spreadsheet
  • Synology MailPlus
  • Synology Calendar
Step2. Import API Spec to Postman. Get started
Step3. Set Up Testing Environment for desired package
  • Synology Drive / MailPlus / Calendar
  • Synology Spreadsheet
ChatGPT

Enable the Synology Office Suite API plugin in ChatGPT to generate sample code for you and save your time and effort. Get started

/Support/resources/chatgpt.summary: How do I Chat with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT?
/Support/resources/chatgpt.description:
Purpose

Synology Office Suite APIs provide developers with powerful tools to automate workflows, enhance productivity, and securely integrate Synology data with third-party platforms through REST APIs and webhook support. To save you time and effort, you can enable the Synology Office Suite API GPT in ChatGPT. It can then search through the Synology Office Suite API documentation, extract relevant parameter formats, and generate sample code for you.

This article provides a guide on getting started with Synology Office Suite API GPT on ChatGPT.


Environment
  • DSM 7.2.2 nano3 or above
  • Synology Drive 3.5.2 version or above
  • Synology Office 3.6.0 version or above
  • Synology MailPlus 3.3.1 version or above
  • Synology Calendar 2.5.3 version or above

Resolution
Start Chat
  1. Click this link to start chatting directly, or sign in to the ChatGPT website, and click on Explore GPTs in the upper left corner.

  2. In the search box, type in Synology Office Suite API.

  3. Select and hit Start Chat.

  4. You can now interact with Synology Office Suite API GPT. Select Keep in sidebar to save the GPT on top.

Example Prompts

Here are some example prompts that illustrate how to interact with the Synology Office Suite API GPT.

  • Automatically download new files uploaded to a shared folder on Synology Drive
    I have created a folder to which team members should upload their weekly reports. How to auto download new files uploaded to this folder?

/Support/contact-us.description:
Feature Request

Fill out the Feature Inquiry form and let us know what API you'd like to see implemented.

Community

Ask a question in Synology Community, or check if there is an existing discussion.

/Support/resources/postman/import.summary: How to Import an API Specification and Start Testing with Postman
/Support/resources/postman/import.description:
1. Download and install the Postman API Platform by selecting the appropriate version for your operating system.

  2. In the workspace, click Import to import the API spec for the packages you need. If you haven't downloaded it yet, the links are available here

  3. Select Postman Collection and click View Import Settings to check the additional configuration options.

  4. Navigate to Folder Organization and ensure Tags is selected.

  5. Return to the previous page and click Import.

  6. Set up the testing environment for
    • Synology Drive, MailPlus, Calendar
    • Synology Spreadsheet

/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Spreadsheet APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-spreads.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your Spreadsheet API server URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{bearerToken}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to the Body tab. Fill in username, password, protocol and host for your NAS. Click Send to retrieve your token. For example, if the NAS URL is `https://my-nas:5000`, please fill in `https` for protocol and `my-nas:5000` for host.

  4. Fill in the bearerToken field with the retrieved token.

  5. The token will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.

/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.summary: How to Set Up the Environment for Synology Drive, MailPlus, and Calendar APIs
/Support/resources/postman/setup-others.description:
If you haven't imported the API spec yet, please follow the instructions [here](#docs-/Support/resources/postman/import).
  1. Switch to the Authorization tab and fill in your NAS URL in the baseUrl field.

  2. Hover {{apiKey}} and click Collection to create the variable for this collection.

  3. Go to Authorization > Sign in and switch to Body tab. Fill in account and password. Click Send to retrieve your sid.

  4. Copy the retrieved sid. Fill in the apiKey field in the format of id={sid}.

  5. The apiKey will be applied to all other API endpoints. You can start testing them.
